p: Even though the vaccine is imperfect, vaccine delivery remains a feasible way to control dengue infection ( figure 5 a). However, coupling this with SIT vector control, can further reduce the impact from the primary and secondary dengue infections caused by the imperfect vaccine strategy ( figure 5 b). Interestingly, there is a single optimal solution to vector control releases for all vaccination costs under imperfect vaccines, this is owing to the new, limited effectiveness of the vaccine. Because all people will be at risk of a secondary infection, vector control methods will always be required in equal measure to tackle this threat, regardless of how many vaccines are administered.
